FuncDef: This command generates a PKCS#10 formatted certificate request by using a local existing key pair file.
CLIs: gen-local-cert-req keypair <url-string> subject-dn <subject-dn> [ domain-name <name> ] [ ip-addr <ip-address> ] file <url-string> [ hash-alg hash-algorithm ]

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the name of the keyfile in cf3:\system-pki\key that is used to generate a certificate request.
Specifies the distinguish name that is used as the subject in a certificate request, including:. Values-attr1=val1,attr2=val2... where: attrN={C|ST|O|OU|CN}, 256 chars max.
Specifies a domain name string can be specified and included as the dNSName in the Subject Alternative Name extension of the certificate request.
Specifies an IPv4 address string can be specified and included as the ipAddress in the Subject Alternative Name extension of the certificate request.
Specifies the certificate URL. This URL could be either a local CF card path and filename to save the certificate request; or an FTP URL to upload the certificate request.
Specifies the hash algorithm to be used in a certificate request. Values-sha1, sha224, sha256, sha384, sha512.
